servinfo.title: DTC P0470: Exhaust Pressure Sensor Malfunction

item.ptxt: Conditions for applying fault finding procedures to stored faults:
The fault is declared present after the engine is started or following a road test.
The Injection warning light (gravity 1 warning light) is lit.
The diagnostic of the diesel particulate filter is inhibited.
Diesel particulate filter regenerations are inhibited.

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: For wiring circuit and connector number, refer to A-5 Engine and A/C Control System Circuit Diagram (DSL) .

entry.ptxt: Open circuit or short circuit to vehicle body ground

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CO: Open circuit and CC.1: Short circuit to +12 V

entry.ptxt: Check the condition of the connectors on the differential pressure sensor and the ECM.
Check the following connections for insulation, continuity and make sure there is no interference resistance:

item.ptxt: Between “C89-2” wire of differential pressure sensor connector and “C85-12” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C89-3” wire of differential pressure sensor connector and “C85-14” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C89-1” wire of differential pressure sensor connector and “C86-42” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: Check for the presence of ground on “C89-2” of the differential pressure sensor connector.
If the fault is still present, change the differential pressure sensor and recheck.
If the fault is still present, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CO.0: Open circuit or short circuit to vehicle body ground

entry.ptxt: Check the continuity, the absence of interference resistance and the insulation from vehicle body ground of the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “C89-3” wire of differential pressure sensor connector and “C85-14” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C89-1” wire of differential pressure sensor connector and “C86-42” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, change the differential pressure sensor and recheck.
If the fault is still present, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for 1.DEF: Inconsistency of signal and 2.DEF: Signal outside lower limit

entry.ptxt: Check the condition of the pressure pipes on the differential pressure sensor.
Verify that they are sealed and check their position.
Check the condition of the connectors on the differential pressure sensor and the ECM.
Check the continuity and for the absence of interference resistance on the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “C89-3” wire of differential pressure sensor connector and “C85-14” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C89-1” wire of differential pressure sensor connector and “C86-42” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, change the differential pressure sensor and recheck.
If the fault is still present, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
